p: Among all persons sharing DRMs ( n = 175), those sharing K103N were significantly younger (aOR per 1 year increase: 0.93, 0.88–0.98, P = 0.003), were less prone to belong to larger clusters (aOR per cluster size unit increase: 0.66, 0.53–0.82, P < 0.001) and were less frequent after 2016 (2017 aOR = 0.25, 0.08–0.80, P = 0.016) (Table 3).
